text: You guys, I love this app and the idea of having my conversations actually be private. My husband and I use this with each other and we love it! My only complaint/questionâ€¦ when Iâ€™m listening to a podcast and I go to use my Wire app to text him something, it shuts down my podcast. Iâ€™ve turned off my mic and its still happening. Am I doing something wrong? Otherwise awesome app!
title: Iâ€™m a big fan

text: Love the premise. Interface looks great, but have to go to web site for instructions. App robot, Otto, cute but not helpful for problem resolution. Didnâ€™t get information about the required size for the photo until I failed to load one.  While testing, attempted connection to someone standing next to me and it never happened. The web app does not work on Safari. Have to go to OS X app to set preferences â€” no way to do it on the iOS app. Have to create account on OS X with email but on iOS it asks for phone number. I should be able to create just one account to handle both email and phone number. Deleted on both platforms. Will try again in a few weeks as I think the app concept is promising.
title: Not ready for prime time

text: I have been using wire of and on since its first release. It's gotten better, and it has SO much potential, but with each release it seems to get more polished on the surface without  any work on the foundation. The ability to make adjustments is useless and unintuitive at absolute best, with an appalling lack of basic necessary options. The notification system is STILL just as broken and useless as it was in the earliest versions. How could that not have been properly fixed by now? That utterly annoying reminder box to add contacts that you can't dismiss, even when you already have the contacts you want, and use the app to chat with them. Useless and annoying. I could go on, but the reality is that wire at its heart is a great app, and could be a wonderful replacement for Skype, which I can imagine I'm not alone in this thinking. And it has a user base who wants to use it, but the wire team is not fixing the basic issues that need to be fixed. If wire ever expects to have wide adoption of its app, it needs to start working on what matters. You have a great interface, but if it doesn't work right under the hood, it's useless. I want to love this app, I've gotten friends to use it, but progress where it counts is slow or so far non existent. That won't cut it. Would love to give it 5 stars, but at present, wire doesn't deserve it.
title: STILL needs work

text:

title: Blocked in the UAE

text: I switched to this app within 10 minutes of reading about out. I also got my friend of it and it's all we talk on now. My only complaint is that I can't send messages while I'm in a call. Other than that's it has a gorgeous design, a brilliant user interface, and must have features. Perfection.
title: Amazing

text: Wire is missing the ability to backup chats and send videos. The worst part of the app is that the notifications to not always work properly. The design of this app is spectacular, however, there are still many practical improvements that this app has to make.
title: Lacking some basic features

text:
Love the App, it does everything you need folks. Video calls, gifs, chat, pics & vids, phone calls ... all that, AND alleged end-to-end encryption better than Telegrams, I say get it folks.

But, to the developers, unless I'm missing something, and can't find it - for the love of god, WE NEED VOICE NOTES! I really hope I just can't find it. But come on, that's a basic-basic. Oh, and the interface is really smooth. So smooth, I have trouble finding where I need to go sometimes. 

But yeah, add voice notes, and I'd upgrade this to five stars.

14Mar2016 EDIT: IT ALSO NEEDS THE ABILITY TO SEND VIDEOS FROM MY CAMERA ROLL!! What the hell, man? Why make a great app, then leave out the simplest things, is it technical?

Although, I just noticed that it DOES send gifs from my camera roll, which is nice. But movies guys, you gotta enable the sending of movies too.
title: Just needs one more thing...

text: Can't log out without uninstalling app and reinstalling again. Can't update information, like a phone number. If you change numbers, you'll have to uninstall and reinstall. Same thing if you want to create a new account because old account will remain and it can't be changed without uninstalling and reinstalling again. If you want more than one account, you're out of luck.
title: Needs a lot more work.

text:
I have been looking for a Skype replacement for years!! Well, I have found it. MUCH better design than Skype and easy to use. Plus, complete call privacy, too (with Skype, everything you do is tracked!)

The only reason I have not completely abandoned Skype is the landline calling ability, ability to be called from a landline, and voicemail. When Wire adds these services, Iâ€™m totally dumping Skype!

Thanks for a great app! Keep up the good work and I look forward to the premium features.
title: Wire is Fantastic!

text:
It took a day to learn the little the minimalistic controls.  The settings are well hidden :)

The app does what it says it does and is very clean and quick.

My only complaint is not being able to change the message notification sound.  If one is able to change it I have not found the control yet and it is not for a lack of trying.
title: Great app!

text:
I hate Skype. Filled with ads, crashes, cuts out on calls, lags, not a fun experience since Microsoft bought them out.

This app is great! It looks and feels nice, works well, and has all the features of Skype without the bloat and ads.

Try it out!
title: If you're sick of Skype, try this one out!

text: Adding contacts can be a little confusing but the interface is clean and pleasing to look at. I love the end to end privacy and the seamless integration of gifs. 5/7.
title: I Love It

text:
The UX on here can be a little cumbersome to navigate at times, but it's beautiful otherwise. Always on end-to-end encryption ensures all messages remain secure, which is a MUST.

While I appreciate that Wire uses Free (as in freedom) and Open Source software to handle the encryption, I don't believe the entire app is open source, which leaves the potential for a hidden flaw or backdoor. Until the app is fully open sourced, I continue to recommend Signal from Openwhispersystems instead.
title: Gorgeous app that takes bold steps to protect privacy

text: Wire has made a lot of improvement since I first started using it
title: Great new update
